attributes.action: Consultants or GPs to do PIP, DLA and ESA assessments for people with IBD
attributes.background: To get medical assessments conducted by qualified consultants and GPs who understand patients’ conditions in Crohn’s and Ulcerative Colitis, which can give accurate information about their disabilities to support their claims for PIP, DLA and/or ESA.
attributes.additional_details: I suffer from Ulcerative Colitis, ADHD, OCD, Anxiety and Depression Disorder and Cluster 4 which means I can't deal with day to day life. I'm on a drug called Infliximab Infusion which is for my IBD and have to have it every 6-8 weeks in hospital in the Infusion Unit. This suppresses my immune system,  which means I am prone to infections. I have been rejected twice by PIP saying my IBD and Mental Health Issues don't affect me in my day to day life; I am now waiting for a tribunal.

attributes.action: Ban George Soros from the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Whilst the UK welcomes foreign business, Mr Soros has proved by his actions that he is no friend of the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: He has a conviction in France for insider trading. He has donated money to a group which is campaigning against the democratic decision to leave the EU.

attributes.action: End all local and national public sector service outsourcing
attributes.background: The recent collapse of Carillion has brought attention to the failings of the private sector in delivering vital public services. This petition calls to end all future outsourcing of public service contracts both locally and nationally including councils, health, education and the civil service.
attributes.additional_details: In order for this to be enforced, the petition is calling for legislation ruling such contracts unlawful.

attributes.action: Keep the category of sex a mandatory question in the 2021 Census.
attributes.background: We oppose the published tentative recommendation by the Office of National Statistics to make sex a non-mandatory field in the 2021 Census. We demand that sex remains a mandatory question in the Census and is included in all government demographic data collection in accordance with SDG5 commitments.
attributes.additional_details: Data collection disaggregated by sex gives us vital information for policy making and distribution of resources.  If implemented, the ONS recommendation will make widely acceptable that sex becomes a voluntary question. This will render useless equal opportunities monitoring designed to combat sex discrimination. It will influence governments worldwide making difficult the monitoring of imbalances resulting from sex-selective abortion, female infanticide and unequal treatment of girls and women.

attributes.action: Re introduce the MenC vaccine for babies aged 12 weeks of age.
attributes.background: From July 2016, the MenC vaccine for 12 week old babies was discontinued from the NHS childhood vaccination programme.
attributes.additional_details:
In a letter to Public Health England in March 2016 The Joint Committee on Vaccination (JCVI) recommended that infants aged 12 weeks no longer require the vaccination against meningococcal serogroup C (MenC) due to the success of the immunisation programme that started in 1999.
One case is one too many and today there is a baby girl in Bradford fighting for her life after contracting MenC at the age of 10 months.

attributes.action: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis: need more funding for research, awareness, support
attributes.background: Their are 250,000 men, women, children in the UK suffering from ME. While other illnesses get support, sufferers are told it a psychological illness and offered a variety of therapy. But the answers lie with the biomedical scientists, who need more funding to find cause and cure.
attributes.additional_details: My daughter is one of the next generation having to endure this horrific sentence of trying to save as much energy just to try and get through the day so they don't sink further into their world of illness. For many sufferers who are older it may be too late, as half their lives has already been blighted and damaged on this devastating journey - many confined to their beds, a shadow of all their hopes and dreams been ripped away from them, never being able to reach their true potential. We owe it now to give the next generation a chance to find a cure to fulfil their potential and become part of life again. We need the government to listen to our voice and give sufferers the funding, support, respect they desperately need.

attributes.action: Provide a website allowing schools to advertise staff vacancies for free.
attributes.background: Over £50 million a year is spent by UK schools advertising job vacancies and some £500 million on supply teachers. This is due, largely, to the extortionate fees charged by current suppliers. In 2015, at the ASCL conference, Justine Greening promised this issue would be addressed. It hasn't been.
attributes.additional_details:
Cost of Advertising:
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2016/jul/26/secondary-schools-spent-56m-teacher-job-ads-labour

Cost of Supply Teachers: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/2017/02/21/school-spending-supply-teacher-agencies-jumps-fifth-inthree/

Cost of Supply Agencies:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationnews/12040309/Schools-spending-thousands-on-agencies-to-recruit-teachers.html

Government Recognition: p24 'Teacher Recruitment and Retention' Briefing Paper 19/0118

attributes.action: Ban the terrier men's terriers from trail hunts.
attributes.background: Since the Fox Hunting Ban in 2004, the terrier men are now simply there to lay the trail. The terriers are no longer necessary. Terriers were only used to flush out foxes before the ban.
attributes.additional_details:
The artificial scents that hunts lay should not lead into a badger sett or into a hole in the ground.
In traditional foxhunting the terriermen were used to stop/block fox earths and badger setts in the area where the hunting was to take place to prevent foxes from going to ground. The foxes would be located using terriers, dug out and fox bolted to be hunted again by the hounds. It's hard to imagine which roles terriers could now play in trail hunting and shouldn't be found with trail hunts.

attributes.action: Make student paramedics eligible for the NHS learning support fund
attributes.background: The Dept of Health established a fund to provide extra financial support for Healthcare students which excludes paramedics. Student paramedics face similar costs and should not be excluded. Our country is short of paramedics and the exclusion makes it even more challenging to qualify.

attributes.action: Build a new A&E Hospital CENTRAL to St Albans, Watford and Dacorum.
attributes.background: We call on the NHS decision makers to instruct West Herts Hospital Trust (WHHT) to amend their Strategic Outline Case to include the most sensible, popular and cost-effective option of building a new A&E hospital in a more accessible and central location than Vicarage Road, Watford.
attributes.additional_details: WHHT have approved plans to redevelop Watford General Hospital as Our A&E Hospital. This is despite the difficulties for many getting to WGH, the sharp gradient of the site, being next-door to a PL football club and the disruption for patients, visitors and staff until it is completed in 2030.A brand new and central West Herts A&E Hospital could be delivered earlier, be less disruptive to hospital services, cost less and provide a better long-term acute care solution for the whole of West Herts.

attributes.action: Grant leave to  undocumented Zimbabweans with at least 15years residence in UK
attributes.background: Since  at least 2000,  thousands of Zimbabwean citizens have fled the turbulent political, social and economic situation in Zimbabwe. A  significant number of Zimbabweans with at least 15years residence remain  here undocumented, despite perpetual gross human rights violations in Zimbabwe.
attributes.additional_details: The Zimbabwean government has brought its own citizens to their knees. The situation there is not getting any better. One only has to look at the news reports. Rather than expect a return to a country that is clearly "broken", there is  more humane, compassionate and tolerant action that the UK government can take. Grant leave to remain to undocumented Zimbabweans with at least 15years residence in the UK, further taking into account the best interests of their minor children born here.

attributes.action: Mandate re-homing of suitable beagles and other species used for animal research
attributes.background: An Advice Note was issued by the Animal Scientific Regulation Unit at the Home Office in 2015 encouraging research/ breeding facilities to re-home these animals but an Advice Note is not Mandatory.  There is evidence that animals are released under the radar or the advice is ignored.
attributes.additional_details: There can be a life after laboratories for suitable animals!!  Mandatory legislation will guarantee adherance to the law and will ensure that release & re-homings will be conducted officially and transparently for those animals who achieve the criteria in ASAP 1986. This will ensure that animals can enjoy normal lives in domestic enviroments once they have been socialised and domesticated properly, and re-homed to new owners who have been extensively checked as suitable.

attributes.action: Demand For Tougher Action Against Moped Crime
attributes.background: Members of the public are becoming increasingly concerned and frustrated as to how moped crime is being dealt with. We want the government to take action. Moped crime (theft and acts of violence carried out on stolen mopeds) is increasing at an alarming rate. The government must act now
attributes.additional_details:
We the public want the authorities to issue police with greater power and resources in tackling this crimewave. 
Allow the police to pursue these thugs without fear of causing harm or injury to the criminals 
Implement a task force and better resources in dealing with the escalating moped crime
Afford police the time and resources to process evidence handed in by members of the public that would assist in any investigation
To provide secure fixing points for motorcycles and mopeds in the city

attributes.action: To consider the removal of parental responsibility for absent parents.
attributes.background: As a single parent, I believe I should behold the right to make decisions based on the benefit of my child solely as her primary and only care giver.
attributes.additional_details: For example, if an absent father makes the choice to pay no attention their child, I don’t think it's acceptable for any single parent to have to resort to permission from said father regarding decisions the mother wishes to make such as health, schooling and country of residency, if it will work in the best interests of the child.

attributes.action: Increase the sentence for failure to stop after a fatal road traffic collision
attributes.background: My brother, Andy Lindup, was killed in a hit and run in Dec 2016. By the time the driver was arrested, it was too late to breathalyse him and gather evidence for a charge of dangerous driving for which he could have faced up to 14 years in prison. Instead he got just 6 months for failure to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
The sentence for failing to stop after a fatal road collision must be made equal to the maximum sentence for death by dangerous driving. Otherwise, there is absolutely no incentive for drivers to stop. Why would anyone stop if they knew they could face 14 years as opposed to just 6 months? My family will never know if the driver who killed my brother was under the influence or not. If he wasn’t, maybe he would have stopped if the law was different. If he was, then the law has let him escape justice.
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5168331/Family-man-killed-hit-run-call-law-change.html

attributes.action: Endometriosis awareness campaign for women aged between 14-18 in Education
attributes.background: As a sufferer or Endometriosis I strongly believe if I was educated on the signs of Endometriosis I would have pushed for a earlier diagnosis which could effectively prevented mine from becoming so severe that it has taken over my life. I wish to take part in the campaign as i want to help others.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 women suffer with Endometriosis 
There is no cure for Endometriosis 
Endometriosis needs to be bought into education 
Endometriosis causes infertility 
Women are unable to work due to severe Endometriosis 
Women face surgery just months apart because it rapidly grows back

attributes.action: Review the effectiveness of the outdated Child Destruction legislation
attributes.background: In June 2015 I was a victim of a violent assault during my 8th month of pregnancy. One of the two males who attacked me was the guy who got me pregnant. Unfortunately, this resulted in me giving birth to a stillborn baby boy Joel.
attributes.additional_details:
The Child Destruction legislation was introduced in 1929 as part of the Infant Life Act, to tackle late-term backstreet abortions. In modern times - though rarely used - the legislation has been used to convict perpetrators who have used violence with the intent to harm pregnant women whose babies are capable of living outside the mother's womb.

Due to the complexities of the law, there have been a number of inconsistencies when it comes to prosecuting and sentencing perpetrators.
#amendCDlaw

attributes.action: Cancel the smart meter roll-out
attributes.background:
We call on the Government to cancel the smart meter roll-out, on the grounds of:
1) Health-they emit microwave radiation, a Group 2B Carcinogen 
2) Safety-can cause fires 
3) Privacy-consumption data can be tracked/sold 
4) Security-can be hacked 
5) Cost-reports suggest £400+ per household
attributes.additional_details:
Smart Attack
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N29AtA3VodU

Are smart meters to blame for house fires? Mail
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4737864/Are-smart-meter-blame-house-fires.html

...smart meters will cost each household £420 - This Is Money
http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-4846700/Smart-meters-cost-household-420.html

Warning over smart meters privacy risk - BBC
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-18407340

Stop Smart Meters UK
http://stopsmartmeters.org.uk/

attributes.action: To allow psv Licence holders to upgrade free to a class 2 lorry licence.
attributes.background: As a psv driver, you are driving vehicles that are longer than a class 2 lorry. And busses can weigh a lot more than a lorry as well. With a bus you are carrying precious cargo (passengers) so why can you not allow a psv licence holder to be allowed an automatic right to a class 2 licence.
attributes.additional_details: There is a huge shortage of hgv drivers within the UK. So surely by allowing a psv licence holder the right to a class 2 lorry licence, without the need of a further driving exam would make a lot of sense.

attributes.action: UK Government to pass a law requiring Vets to scan all newly registered animals.
attributes.background:
In March this year my British Shorthair Tabby disappeared.  Extensive searches were made contacting all organisations. On targetting Veterinary Surgeries not all were routinely scanning newly registered cats and dogs which was concerning.
I want any suspected thefts to be reported to the Police.
attributes.additional_details: Subsequently another two similar profile cats have disappeared within 0.5miles of my rural community. While these incidents have been reported to local Police their hands are tied and limited with what they can actually do. This loophole allows unscrupulous thieves to identify themselves as the owners thus depriving the true owners of their treasured pets. Kennel Club figures for 2014 show 70,000 animals missing/stolen and Direct Line figures for 2015/16 show cat theft up by 40% and the true numbers of thefts nearer 360,000. Only 10% of cats were retrieved by microchip which in large part is due to the inconsistency of scanning newly registered animals.

attributes.action: Adopt the EU's Anti Tax Avoidance Directive whether we leave or remain in the EU
attributes.background: To stop the UK becoming a tax haven when we leave the EU.  Where the less well off bear a greater share of the tax burden than the very rich and corporations.
attributes.additional_details: One fear is that Brexit is simply so the very rich and corporations can avoid the EU's Anti Tax Avoidance Directive.  They would be able to store their money in the UK and aggressively avoid paying tax. If the UK adopted the EU's Anti Tax Avoidance Directive it would ensure everyone paid tax fairly and give one less reason to object to Brexit

attributes.action: That Parliament should not agree to the UK being part of an EU defence force.
attributes.background: President of the Commission said that the EU is moving to having a single defence force.   To avoid  UK forces being committed to such a military force under EU law, Brexit agreement should contain clear legal drafting that  excludes any such possibility.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-31796337 contains a report on the Presidents' policy by the BBC.   The joint statement between the President and the Prime Minister of 16th October mentions  security co-operation between the UK and the EU in the context of what happens after Brexit.

attributes.action: Don't merge the Parachute Regiment units with the Royal Marines Units.
attributes.background:
We are launching a petition against the proposals to merge the Parachute Regiment units and Royal Marines units.

We must put a stop to the government destroying our Armed Forces.

We do not want the government to merge these units and we do not want any more cuts to be made on our Armed Forces.

attributes.action: Introduce automatic penalties when a contact order is broken repeatedly.
attributes.background: There are many cases documented where one parent repeatedly breaks the Contact Order without penalty and the injured party (normally the father) has to keep going back to Court, at their expense, to try and see their child. This often results in fathers losing contact with their child.
attributes.additional_details: Introducing more stringent automatic penalties when a parent repeatedly breaks a contact order without good reason will help keep parents in their children’s lives. We would also like a named body that can investigate when a contact order is breached. In many European countries, the police intervene immediately to ensure the rights of the child to see their non-resident parent are protected. The existing system is too slow and unwieldy and the penalties are unenforceable.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for any MP to lie in parliament or knowingly deceive the public.
attributes.background: Repeal Parliamentary Privilege and reform Contempt of Parliament to make it illegal for MPs to lie or knowingly deceive the public in the execution of their duties. This must include campaigning and all statements made in Parliament or the media. Breach of this condition must trigger a by-election.
attributes.additional_details: It should be a legal offence in the UK, as it is in some other countries and nations, to lie, wilfully mislead or knowingly deceive the public in execution of ones duties or whilst occupying a public office. This should include, but not be limited to; campaigning, liasing with the media or in any public forum. This should be covered by 'Misconduct in Public Office'. A breach of such conditions should result in dismissal from office, or at the very least a by-election for the seat in question.

attributes.action: Publicly reinforce the UK Government's commitment to preserving Net Neutrality.
attributes.background: Given the recent worrying proposals by the US Federal Communications Commission, now more than ever our government must make an early commitment to maintaining a British equivalent to the EU's 'Regulation on Open Internet Access' as part of the Great Repeal Bill during the Brexit transition.

attributes.action: Increase compulsory school age to 7
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest compulsory school ages in the world, and yet is behind other countries academically. Starting school at age 4 has a negative impact on children's education often leading to children being labelled with having additional needs when in reality they are simply not ready.

attributes.action: Hold a general election within the next 3 months.
attributes.background: The current government is dysfunctional. Current policies ranging from NHS and social care to Brexit are causing great dismay. This country deserves better. The current government refuses to contribute to parliamentary votes, uses filibustering tactics and lacks transparency. This is not democracy.

attributes.action: UK Government should urge Iran, Iraq and Turkey to lift blockade on Kurdistan.
attributes.background: In retaliation to an overwhelmingly YES vote for independence by the Kurds in the recent referendum, the Iraqi Government, Turkey & Iran are to impose a blockade on Kurdistan. If enforced, such a blockade will hamper the fight against ISIS and cause a real humanitarian crisis in the region.
attributes.additional_details: When the entire world woke up to witness ISIS sweeping across Syria and Iraq slaughtering thousands in 2014, it was the Kurd who took up the fight on behalf of the world and broke the myth of the so called “death cult” on the ground, whilst holding fast to the universal values and human rights by giving refuge to almost 2 million displaced Iraqis and Syrian within its territories. A semi-autonomous Kurdistan has been a source for stability and peace in Iraq; an independent Kurdistan will most certainly be a greater force for peace and stability in the wider region. We, the undersigned, call upon the UK Government to utilise its diplomatic means to exert pressure on these countries to stop the BLOCKADE resulting in yet another humanitarian crisis in Kurdistan and the wider region.

attributes.action: Change the law on Cross Border Hire of taxis and private hire vehicles.
attributes.background: Nationally in the UK thousands of drivers are exploiting the sub-contracting clause in the Deregulation Act 2015(section 55).This has allowed the situation whereby a person licensed in one authority can work as a PHV in any other authority in the country.
attributes.additional_details:
A good example of this exploitation would be; if a person took, and failed, a Knowledge test in one of the 316 Licensing authorities in the UK. This person could then choose to take a Knowledge Test in an authority with far fewer roads to learn, pass the test with ease, and then go back to work in the area they had originally failed in. 
The rise in drivers working for "app based" companies has seen the situation where drivers licensed in London are working in different authorities nationwide.

attributes.action: Make Autistic Spectrum Disorder widely known about within the DWP Assessments.
attributes.background: Regardless of where on the Autistic Spectrum an individual is, low or high functioning, they are similar but all have different needs. The biggest problem all ASD sufferers have in common is social and communication skills.
attributes.additional_details: It's a condition that one is born with and it will never not be there. There isn't medication to lessen the symptoms of Autism or to control them. There is a lack of education with the very people we put our trust in. The DWP response to a Freedom of Information (FOI) request stated 80% of Mandatory reconsiderations are rejected as performance indicators. That's almost 9 out of 10 people! There is much needed information being missed out in assessments where invisible illnesses are concerned.

attributes.action: Automatic Settlement Rights to the Elderly Parents of the British Citizens
attributes.background: Elderly parents/relatives should be given an automatic right to settle in the UK subject to their UK family’s ability to maintain and accommodate them without recourse to the public funds.
attributes.additional_details: In the past few years, the immigration rules have made it virtually impossible for the elderly dependent parents/relatives of the British citizen to settle in the UK. This has led to the elderly parents forced to leave the UK and/or refusal of their entry clearance application resulting them living alone without the vital physical and emotional support. A change in the law is well overdue to make sure that they live with the dignity that they deserve in the most vulnerable years of their lives with their loved ones.

attributes.action: Review the share of Government money spent on Northamptonshire services
attributes.background:
Several ​le​ss-deprived counties ​get much more spent on them per head than​ Northamptonshire​, mainly due to an out-of-date funding model​.

We need a fairer allocation scheme to better reflect today’s population growth and levels of deprivation in Northamptonshire.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to properly fund our roads, child social care, police, NHS and fire service and look after our elderly people. All of these are falling further behind other counties every year.

Surrey gets £134 more per person​ this year despite being considerably ​less needy, according to Government statistics.

The Local Government Association says Northamptonshire is the county least able to fund itself in the future.

attributes.action: Provide women's health physio to all post natal woman for pelvic health advice.
attributes.background: I gave birth at the end of last year to my second child and was shocked by a letter from my GP saying unless I had "persistent bleeding/pain or wanted contraception" a routine 6 weeks check up was not required. This left me with no checks post major abdominal surgery which is very worrying.
attributes.additional_details: Women's health physios are perfect professionals for assessing, and treating the mother post natally. They can check many concerns like scar tissue healing, gynae health and abdominal separation issues. Sadly mothers are being left without anyone to talk to about incontinence, prolapse,diastasis recti problems and all of these can be prevented or at least symptoms managed to avoid surgery further down the line. Providing care at this stage will save the NHS money in the long run.

attributes.action: Exempt kinship care households from the 2 child restriction on child tax credit
attributes.background: There are around 200,000 children being raised by kinship carers across the UK. Kinship carers are grandparents, older siblings and other relatives and friends who step in to care for children, many of whom would otherwise be in the care system.
attributes.additional_details: 49% of kinship carers have to give up work to take on the children (Family Rights Group Survey). This often pushes the household into poverty. Some kinship carers are being hit by the new child tax credit limit. Kinship carers already raising two children can't now claim child tax credit for any baby to whom they then give birth. This penalises, for example, young women raising their teenage siblings following their parents' death, who now can't claim child tax credit for their own baby.

attributes.action: Cancel South Western Railway’s contract & to investigate their mismanagement.
attributes.background:
South Western Railway was awarded the South Western franchise in March 2017, & took over from South West Trains on the 20th August. SWT had managed the franchise for nearly 20 years.

Since the takeover, the number of delays have increased, delays have got longer, & cancellations have increased.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should investigate why the franchise has significantly worsensed since it changed hands, & why it changed during the Waterloo upgrade. Why is the service worse after the upgrade?

Need to compare the % of delayed trains now with the amount of delayed trains SWT’s had. Also stats for the length of delays, as well as the % of cancelled trains. Not just overal stats either, peak times/rush hour stats need to be anyalsed.

The government needs to consider cancelling SWR’s contract.

attributes.action: Extend the 'Recall of MPs Act 2015'
attributes.background:
The Recall of MPs Act 2015 needs to be extended so that those MPs who go against the will of their own constituents can be recalled.

How can it be a representative democracy if our MPs are allowed to go against the will of the people who elect them to represent them?
attributes.additional_details: Failing to represent those who elect them is as much a travesty as any of the current reasons given for calling for a Recall of any of our elected representatives but at this time the Recall of MPs Act 2015 does not cover such an eventuality and those signing this petition feel that it should.

attributes.action: Anyone convicted of involvement in dog-fighting to receive a custodial sentence.
attributes.background: Although dog-fighting in the UK has been illegal for many years it continues due to the underground nature of those involved. As part of the 'training regime' for fighter dogs, pets are often stolen from gardens etc to be used as 'bait dogs'. They are thrown to the fighter dogs to be torn apart.
attributes.additional_details: Fining those convicted of being involved in dog-fighting is not a deterrent due to the vast amounts of money involved in dog-fighting circles. The only way to address this vile 'blood sport' is to give AUTOMATIC custodial sentences to ANYONE be it those who steal pets to be used as bait dogs, fighter dog owners, organisers and those who attend fights i.e. EVERYONE involved.

attributes.action: make it a legal requirement that all hunting dogs on a hunt should be muzzled.
attributes.background:
Hounds are killing foxes on trail and drag hunts. Where they may follow a live fox scent or come across a fox.
They are also on occasions attacking pet dogs and other wildlife.
They can be very intimidating to general public also.
By having these hunting dogs muzzled would prevent any incidents.

attributes.action: Stop the unfair electoral boundary changes!
attributes.background:
There's currently a plan to reduce the number of MP's by "revising" the electoral boundaries (MP constituency seats).
The changes are not fair. More power will go to the remaining MP's & this is scary. We will permanently lose 50 MP's which will mean our votes matter less. Stop the changes.
attributes.additional_details:
If we have 50 less MP's, those new MP's who take over a neighbouring constituency will have more emails and more letters which they will probably not respond to. We'll have less chances to speak to our MP's. It will also mean less representation in Parliament for the British Public.The population needs proper representation.

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/oct/17/boundary-changes-house-of-commons-mps-ministers-plans
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerrymandering

attributes.action: Protect UK Citizens' existing Freedom of Movement rights in Brexit negotiations
attributes.background: The UK Passport gives us, as EU Citizens, the Right to live and work in 28 EU Countries (& 3 EEA Countries). As UK Citizens, we do not want to lose this Right and ask that our Rights are fully protected and that they are valued and considered in any Brexit negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
The Big EU Passport campaign was started in order to highlight the fact that the Freedom of Movement Rights of UK Citizens, who are currently EU Citizens, are not being prioritised in Brexit negotiations yet we currently have the Right to live and work in 31 countries.
 
Many people use this right in order to work in mainland EU yet live in the UK. Others want to maintain family connections.

For information about our campaign: http://breakingbrexit.blogspot.co.uk/2017/06/big-eu-passport.html

attributes.action: Bring forward the order for the Red Arrows Hawk Jets with BAE Systems
attributes.background: Let’s get backing both the future of The Red Arrows and a great British company; BAE Systems.The Red Arrows; an iconic British treasure which means so much more than money and politics. We need to show the government how much we need to promote national pride in these uncertain times.
attributes.additional_details: The time to act is NOW, BAE Systems is in need of immediate short term stability and the current Red Arrows aircraft only have a limited number of years left before they will be de-commissioned.

attributes.action: Debate effect of pumping out brine at Fleetwood on marine life and livelihoods
attributes.background: Consent has been given for brine to be pumped out at Fleetwood.  Pumping will continue for years, whilst they build underground gas storage caverns. Local experts have concerns about the possible effects on our delicate marine ecology and on local livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details:
There are concerns relating to conservation; the food chain; fishing industry; tourism; polluted water from Fleetwood dock; and the accuracy of dispersal modelling.

We call for a parliamentary debate on the brine discharge and on whether the benefits of this project for the UK outweigh the possible negative impacts on the local area.

attributes.action: Make Houses of Parliament alcohol free.
attributes.background: The issue of sexual harassment at work is a matter of concern, not least within Parliament. We believe Parliament should lead the way in ending this abuse. Many complaints are reported to arise in situations where alcohol is involved. Parliament is a place of work and there is no need for alcohol.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1293902/MPs-drunk-hour-drinking-session-voted-Budget.html The culture of drinking within the Houses of Parliament is a national disgrace. Ending the sale of alcohol, both at bars and with meals, would not only help reduce sexual harassment, but help members stay alert and able to conduct business on behalf of the tax payer. Parliament is a place of work, and there is no need for alcohol to be served.

attributes.action: Guarantee the UK will not introduce Welfare Cards
attributes.background: We the undersigned ask the Secretary of State for Work and Pensions to guarantee that they will prevent any introduction of Welfare Cards and the removal of choice for claimants of Social Security.
attributes.additional_details:
This would only induce further stigmatisation of claimants leading to a failure to the ‘right to live’ (Article 8 & Article 14 HRA) as others in the UK currently enjoy who are employed. 

Many claimants who have paid into the welfare state over their years of work life have found themselves out of work or sick or disabled. This would be social engineering, forcing them to buy goods from government sanctioned suppliers when in many cases goods can be bought cheaper elsewhere.

attributes.action: Recognise nonbinary people in law
attributes.background: We call on the government to recognise nonbinary people in law as distinct from men and women, in the form of a third gender option on passports and birth certificates, the ability to change one's gender legally to a third option with a gender recognition certificate as trans men and women can, etc.
attributes.additional_details: The best estimate we have is that around 0.4% of people are nonbinary (EHRC), over 250,000 people in the UK, comparable to the number of Buddhists in the UK - yet we are not counted in the UK census. We are not protected by the Equality Act unless someone thinks we're trans, we are required to pretend to be men or women when getting married, companies are not required to provide toilets or changing rooms for us, when we're in prison we share it with people whose genders differ from our own.

attributes.action: Give all Ancient Woodland statutory legal protection.
attributes.background: Ancient Woodland is a nationally important wildlife habitat in its own right, acting as a natural flood defence air filter and carbon store, while providing homes for species that depend on it for survival. Once it's gone it's gone, legal protection should be brought in line with SSSIs as a minimum.
attributes.additional_details: With 13% of the UK's landmass covered in woodland, compared to the EU average of around 35% we are significantly lagging behind our European counterparts. We must protect our ancient woodlands as part of a program of woodland expansion that will help us to reduce the concentration of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere and slow the progress of rainwater, reducing flooding downstream. Expanding will help reverse the decline of woodland species as highlighted by the UK State of Nature Report 2016.

attributes.action: Make companies legally obliged to pay mandatory breaks for professional drivers
attributes.background:
LGV and PCV Drivers are legally obliged to take unpaid breaks at very specific times, and can be fined, prosecuted or contracts terminated if they fail to do so.
Despite being unpaid, the drivers responsibility for the vehicle and load still remain, just so long as they are officially “not working”
attributes.additional_details:
It’s considered that a break is time off of work but for a professional Driver this is not the case. When stopping for a break the best scenario they can hope for is to be at a services. Not ideal but when considered that drivers also have to stop in lay-bys at small roads, it neither desirable or relaxing
In a 10 hour day, a Driver will typically be deducted 45mins pay because of his mandatory breaks, when they have barely left the place of work for even a few minutes

attributes.action: Call for a British Government apology for the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre of 1919
attributes.background: In 1919 Colonel Dyer ordered his men to fire, and maybe 1,000 peaceful protesters were left dead. At the time Winston Churchill proclaimed the massacre "monstrous" and the British Government condemned Dyer for his actions, but no apology has since been forthcoming. It is now time to apologise.

attributes.action: Fund a clinical audit of ovarian cancer to urgently improve survival rates
attributes.background: Shockingly, the UK has one of the worst survival rates in Europe for ovarian cancer. It’s too late for so many women like my mum, but we must do better. In 2015 the Chief Medical Officer called for an audit of ovarian cancer treatment & survival. Funding an audit is key to saving more women's lives.
attributes.additional_details: When a woman is diagnosed with ovarian cancer in the UK the odds are stacked against her. It is one of the deadliest cancers for women and only 46% will survive 5 years beyond a diagnosis. UK survival rates lag significantly behind the USA, France and Germany, and even countries such as Thailand and Romania. We urgently need earlier detection and better treatment to improve women’s chances. If my mum’s cancer had been diagnosed earlier she would have had a 90% chance of survival.
